intro: Shawia strigosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf shrub, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically purple or red in color. Shawia strigosa thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid environments. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact growth habit and seasonal blooming.
